III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
Description following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 walked into Youth A's bedroom and grabbed Youth A's
breast area with both hands.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant 1:
Complainant 1 was contacted via telephone on 12/13/24. No new
information was shared.
Administrator 1:
Administrator 1 reported Youth A has made allegation in the past
to be removed from programs. Administrator 1 reported Staff 1
does not have disciplinary action in her file that relates to these
allegations. Administrator 1 reported Youth A has filed three
written grievances, which were all unfounded. Administrator 1
reported these past grievances appear to be an attempt on the
part of Youth A to leave the program. Concerning the specific
allegations, Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 is a good staff and
there have not been any issues with Staff 1. Administrator 1
reported it would not be abnormal for a staff to walk into a youth’s
bedroom.
*The following interviews were conducted face to face at the
facility on 12/17/24 with DHS Worker and Detective from the
Oakland County Sherrif’s Office.
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported Youth A is an anxious and easily agitated youth in
the program. Staff 1 reported Youth A has been on suicide watch
due to being a danger to self and others. Staff 1 reported Youth A
does not always complete her work in school. Staff 1 reported she
has minimal conversation with Youth A due to the allegations she
creates about others. Staff 1 reported she works the morning shift,
so the youth are normally waking up, completing hygiene and then
going to school. Staff 1 reported the teachers are teaching so
there is not constant interaction with the youth and staff. Staff 1
described the morning wake up as opening doors and turning on
2

lights. Staff 1 reported she has a structured routine in the morning
so that safety is established. Staff 1 reported staff can enter a
youth’s room if necessary. Staff 1 reported she went into Youth
A’s room once in the morning. Staff 1 reported she remembered
this particular date because it was a “snow day.” Youth A had
asked Staff 1 for assistance in opening her window shades. Staff
1 reported she went into the room and was unable to open them.
She then left the room. Staff 1 reported the shades are inside the
windows which is why she couldn’t figure it out. Staff 1 reported
she has never touched Youth A on her breast or grabbed her
breasts.
Staff 2:
Staff 2 reported she has worked with the agency for six months.
Staff 2 reported she works often with Staff 1. Staff 2 reported she
loves working with Staff 1 and learns a lot from her. Staff 2
reported she has never seen Staff 1 unprofessional or
inappropriate with any of the youth.
Staff 3:
Staff 3 reported she works with Staff 1 twice a week for the last six
months. Staff 3 reported she has never witnessed Staff 1 being
unprofessional or inappropriate with the youth. Staff 3 proceeded
to state Staff 1 doesn’t let the youth get close to her. Staff 1
doesn’t allow hugs, side hugs, or fist bumps. All of the youth are
aware of this. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 has good boundaries with
the youth and has witnessed this. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 had
good boundaries with Youth A as well and did not notice anything
different in the way Staff 1 treated any of the youth. Staff 3
reported Youth A is anxious, quiet, and has made “general”
accusations to be removed from the placement. Staff 3 reported
these accusations are mostly about her health, in an attempt to go
to the hospital and leave Camp Oakland.
Youth A:
Youth A reported Staff 1 asked to come into her room one
morning and “groped” her by grabbing her breasts. Youth A
reported no one else was in the room with them and no one else
saw it. Youth A was unable to provide any other details, but stated
she did not ask Staff 1 to help her with the blinds in her room.
Youth A reported Staff 1 is a nice staff and has not had any
conflicts with her up until this situation.
Youth B:
Youth B reported she walked past Youth A’s bedroom the morning
of the allegations. Youth B reported it was a “snow day.” Youth B
3

reported she was on her way to the restroom so didn’t see
everything. Youth B reported she only saw Staff 1 by the window
and Youth A sitting on her bed, while she walked by. Youth B
reported she was aware of the allegations that Youth A had made
against Staff 1. Youth B reported at lunch time, a week after the
incident, Youth A told her Staff 1 came into her room and placed
one hand on Youth A’s chest. Youth B reported Youth A said,
“Maybe this will get me home sooner.” Youth B reported she has
never seen Staff 1 touch any youth. Youth B reported Staff 1 is
considered a “strict” staff.
Documents:
• I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. All clearances and
training are up to date. There is not disciplinary action in
her file.
• I reviewed the Weekly Update form for December 5, 2024.
This was the “snow day.” The weekly update recorded by
Staff 1 concerning Youth A was: “Met unit goal. Good,
timely AM routine. Completed details. Followed program.
Followed staff direction. Respectful…”
• I reviewed the Oakland County Sherrif Case Report, case
number 240310301. Prosecution is declined; case
dismissed.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. There is no evidence to
validate Staff 1 touching Youth A. Interviews with Administrator 1,
Staff 2, Staff 3, and Youth B reveal Staff 1 as a good staff with
careful boundaries. Youth A was unable to provide details
concerning the event and discussed the incident later with Youth
B, hoping this would get her home sooner. Youth B confirmed
seeing Staff 1 near the window blinds when she walked past
Youth A’s bedroom.
Conclusion Violation Not Established.
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
